intro: Sphondylium subvillosum, commonly known as the silky spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, hairy stems and small, inconspicuous yellow flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Its adaptations to dry climates include reduced leaf surface area and the ability to store water in its stems.
